mods.abstract: Capitals of the Temple of Khnum at Esneh (Ptolemaic-Roman Period); open papyrus capitals of columns in the Temple of Khnum heavily inscribed with images of deities and hieroglyphs, supporting lintel bearing cartouches and rows of inscriptions; rough brick wall (right background); "Zangaki No. 1018 Esneh Colones du temple" in white along bottom of print.

titleInfo.title: Nineteenth and Early Twentieth Century Images of Egypt

location.physicalLocation: Frank H. McClung Museum of Natural History and Culture

recordInfo.recordContentSource: Frank H. McClung Museum of Natural History and Culture

mods.note: Gift of the Friends of Egyptology, McClung Museum of Natural History and Culture, The University of Tennessee
